Yesterday afternoon at Alley 135,

last night on National Highway 1A, passing through

Telecommunications cables were pulled across the national

9:00 p.m. on March 17. A tractor pulling a
trailer was traveling on National Highway 1A
heading from Ho Chi Minh City to the West
while passing through the commune.  Tan Ly Tay,
Chau Thanh district, the tractor got stuck in the
communication cables of many telecommunications units and
pulled them across the highway, causing many
large coils of cables to fall onto the road. The incident caused
traffic chaos across the city in both
directions.  Ho Chi Minh City to the West
and vice versa. After the incident, the
tractor left the scene and
received news that Chau Thanh District Electricity
was present at the scene in coordination with
Tan Ly Tay commune police and people.  People
stopped cars in many directions
on National Highway 1A and Provincial Road 866
and cut off power to cut down many
cable lines on the road. After nearly an
hour, the scene was
resolved. The authorities are investigating.

In Russia, preliminary vote counting results
show that Vladimir Putin won an
overwhelming victory in this year's election and
will certainly continue to lead Russia in the
2024 term.
2030 According to the Russian election commission, the results of counting
more than 50 minutes of votes showed that Mr. Putin
won overwhelmingly in the
election last weekend with 87.7 minutes of
votes, this is also a record high rate in
history.  Modern Russia, meanwhile,
Communist Party of Russia candidate Nicol Kharitonov
ranked second with 4.7 votes,
New People's Party candidate Vladislav
Davan came third with 3.6 and
Liberal Democratic Party candidate Leonis Lsk  With 2.5,
with this result, Mr. Putin will definitely
win the president's favor and become the
leader of Russia in the next 6 years. In his
speech to all Russians, Mr.
Putin affirmed that he will continue his
development goals.  economic society and
building a united Russia
in Australia. Therapy to improve
mental health with cows is
becoming increasingly popular. Thanks to contact
with cute animals, many
sick people have improved quickly.
communication skills as well as self-confidence.
This therapy is currently being carried
out at a horse racing school in
Victoria. The two-mindedness and slow pace of life
are characteristic of cows, so
that they can  The ability to bring
relaxation to those who come into close contact with them when
playing with these friends.
Sometimes I have to adjust
my own pace of life to harmonize with them so that
I can also find reasons to live.
Positively, patients who come into
contact with animals will begin to be
more aware of their own body language and how to
communicate. Thanks to that, their condition will also
begin to improve. Many patients will
say they feel better.  You can experience
significant mental and physical improvements when
interacting with animals, so
animal therapy is increasingly being used by many people
in Australia. However, many
medical professionals are demanding
clinical accreditation.  clearer readiness to
ensure the effectiveness of this therapy. They
also expect more specific instructions
from the government on the use of

at the traditional festival of Marlena, the
Russian people bid farewell to Winter and
Welcome spring with many unique festivals.
One of the outstanding events
is the burning ceremony of a
large art work made of wood and this
year this work carries the image of
a giant mountain to sing the song.  Praising the
power of
nature, the event takes place at the
Nicola Lenes Art Park in the Kaluga region of
Central Russia. Every
Marlena holiday, the park's management will
erect a giant wooden structure with
different shapes.  Over the years since then,
we have built
many works based on
human civilization such as castles and
wooden bridges, but we have never created
a work associated with nature
like a mountain work.  black We want to
praise the power of nature to recreate
volcanic eruptions in real life.
When these structures are burned,
they truly become masterpieces of
fire art, a gift to welcome
spring. This is  traditional in regions following

and Ukraine. This is a festival that takes place in the
last week before the Lenten season of
this community, also known as "
cake week" or "butter week".
